page.title: 10ELIZABETH'S SCHOOL WEEK
page.content: The school (Quadring Primary) is on the boundary of Donington and Quadring. It was built in 1725 or 1726. It educates 46 children at the moment. There are two teachers. One is Mrs. Featherstone who teaches the infant class and the other is Mr. Dainty ,the headteacher and teacher of the junior class. The school starts at 9.00 a.m. and finishes at 3.15 p.m. On Tuesday afternoons we go swimming in Spalding. After swimming mums listen to us read and do sewing. Wednesdays itis recorder, Thursday mums hear us read again and on Friday it is violin. The school runs very happily and busily. With netball, football and chess teams it is rather hectic.
